Text: NYISO Server AccessMarket Participants The NYISO is currently implementing an upgrade to our security systems which appears to be affecting your ability to access the secure part of the NYISO web site We are diligently working to improve your ability to access our systems This is a temporary problem and we expect your access to be improved shortly We will notify you of any status changes Regards NYISO Customer Relations

NYISO Server Access is RestoredMarket Participants Issues involving access to the NYISO secure server have been resolved and you should not have any problems accessing the site We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused Regards NYISO Customer Relations

NYISO Announcement of Reformatted Tariff FilingMarket Participants On November the New York Independent System Operator Inc filed a reformatted version of the NYISO Open Access Transmission Tariff OATT The new version is entitled New York Independent System Operator Inc FERC Electric Tariff Original Volume No This filing was made to comply with the FERCs Order No issued March in Docket No RM FERC Order amended the FERCs regulations concerning the designation of electric rate schedule sheets This order changed the titles and other administrative information to be shown at the top and bottom of each tariff sheet thus necessitating that the NYISO modify the information included on the NYISOs tariff sheets The tariff filed on November does not include any change in the content of the tariff It does include the administrative changes described above and a repagination and reformatting to facilitate existing and future changes This tariff includes all tariff modifications that were filed before September and have been approved by the FERC The tariff does not reflect filings made on or after September The tariff also does not reflect the NYISOs February compliance filing in Docket No ER which still awaits Commission action Once this tariff has been approved by the FERC the NYISO will create and post a consolidated version of the OATT that shows all approved and proposed changes This new consolidated version will be comparable to and replace the current consolidated OATT posted on the NYISO website The November filing can be found on the NYISO website at servicesdocumentsfilingsindexhtml Regards NYISO Customer Relations
